reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was nice and easy. Jose was very nice! The room was spacious, but not great. As other reviews said, it had tons of potential, but was rather empty. You would assume you would have some kind of dining table in a room with a kitchen. The TV is tiny! Noise at night was high, but expected and not a problem. Very nice location being right across from the beach and park. My biggest complaint would be the balcony. It was tiny, odd shaped, faced directly at a building, and was very dirty. There was a roof top of the restaurant or other first level building directly in sight off the balcony and it was full of trash. The carpet and linens were clean, but the carpet had a big hump in it across the room which was annoying.
reviews.title: Average overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was not clean and looked like it needed an uplifting.
reviews.title: Not the Greatest

likes.liked: — the friendly staff you tried to accomodate
likes.disliked: — the cleanliness of the room, location of room, parking setup

reviews.text: One side of the room faced a building under construction and the other side of the room faced a blank wall.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The set up with the parking was horrible. It took up to 30 minutes once to bring the car around. I could have parked my car at the same place they do and pay $24/day instead the high fee that I paid.
reviews.title: Lots of fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The service would have been worth if there was 2 of us. It should be prorated. I also didn't think I got much for the resort fee. There certainly was no daily newspaper either.
reviews.title: Not Good

likes.disliked: — Not clean, less than desirable area of South Beach, weird policies, loud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second trip this year to the Strand, last one was in the spring. Same as the first time, the check-in was easy and pleasant. Unfortunately we arrived around midnight and got a room that was completely unacceptable. Our room was small even though it was a 1-bedroom suite. This was mostly due to the lay-out of that particular one. The sofa was stained and dirty,
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — Parking, you need to know where to go and what to do to get parking that is convenient and that doesn't cost a fortune.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: as well as the carpet in the sitting area. We didn't even bother unpacking as we had to change our room to something more acceptable to be able to stay the 10 days that we had booked. In the morning we went to the front desk to request a change and were put in a room that matched our request which was to be on a upper floor near the back and as far away from the bar as possible. It was clean and fresh. We noticed that the hall carpets were cleaned twice during our stay and that was good to see.
reviews.title: Close to the Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From there on our stay was very nice. We had a problem for the first 3 days that we weren't able to connect to the Internet but as soon as we got a new cable everything worked great.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - but stay in Retro Building at the back for a quite stay, Big Room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is always courteous and helpful which is a great change from the impersonal staff at most large hotels and resorts.
reviews.title: Great position

likes.disliked: — Some air conditioner noise (coming from outside

reviews.text: 2 final notes:
reviews.title: Good hotel for the South Beach experience

likes.liked: — Location in the heart of South Beach
likes.disliked: — Location in the heart of South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel for 6 nights starting 24th Jan following reviews on Tripadvisor and have to say were not disappointed! Location is fantastic as everything is on your doorstep and only a 15min walk from Lincoln where all the shops are. The room was huge and had a lovely small kitchen which was great for making our own breakfast, which we did everyday (after buying OJ, croissants and bagels). The pool, this is fantastic and it was very quiet, the views were fabulous and loungers and cabanas (only 2 of these) were always available - which may be due to the time of year however. Beware though if you don't like birds as a group of seagulls seem to do a fly-by and dip in the pool every 15 minutes or so to cool down! There is no bar at the poolside but drinks are available from the Atlantic bar downstairs and the pool attendant will go for you if required. The music is very loud (we had a room right at the front next to cafe Medi) especially Fri & Sat night (it was much better and went off earlier during the week). You won't notice this if you like to go out and party but if you usually go to bed at midnight or 1am then you will hear the constant music until 3am. I decided that I chose to stay there in the thick of it all so should expect music - otherwise, stay on Collins somewhere! Slept with earplugs and managed to get to sleep easily enough though. Miami beach is gorgeous and everyone is friendly and helpful so I cannot wait to go back - although maybe when the £1 vs $ rate is better since everything was pretty pricey, especially when 18% service added as standard (we were $66 for 2 vodkas and 2 cocktails!). I would however definitely stay at the Strand again!
reviews.title: Location Location Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I must say that everything about my stay at the Strand was positively perfect, and when I return to South Beach I won't stay anywhere else. I will certainly be referring friends and clients to this South Beach diamond in the rough. My friend and I were both celebrating our 30th birthdays and I made mention of this to the Desires Mgr. Betty, and she added some special touches to the room that absolutely had us swooning. I love the roominess and contemporary design of the room, very modern and yet cozy. I loved the pool mainly because it wasn't crowded, I could go and feel like I virtually had the pool all to myself as I peered out over the ocean. At the end of every night I looked forward to returning to my room, and every morning I loved waking up, walking out on the balcony and taking in the ocean air with a beautiful view of the ocean. I was thoroughly impressed with the room, ALL of the staff and how attentive and thoughtful everyone was. Simply an amazing place to stay, and the value is excellent. -Nicole w/ Epiphany Travels Dot Com
reviews.title: Fell in love w/ the Strand

likes.liked: — The pool and the ocean view room with balcony.
likes.disliked: — Very small television, but why watch tv on vacation!?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: ***Please forgive typos. I'm at work and just wanted to get this done as soon as possible but have no time to proof as I've been in SoBe since Thursday and am so far behind in my work!***
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, even better service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I just checked out yesterday and would go back tomorrow if I could. From the minute I walked into the office on check-in day until I hopped in my cab after checking out, The Strand proved to be a gem in SoBe.
reviews.title: i liked the strand a lot

likes.liked: — everything looked/felt brand new in the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I was in town to run the Miami Marathon and wanted to be able to enjoy the sun, be in a location close to the expo, get plenty of rest and have a clean hotel (which I'm told is hard to find on a beach w/out paying very high prices).
reviews.title: One of the Best Hotels on the strip.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our first time in Miami and I'd looked around for a few hotels but, it was the Strand that stuck out.
reviews.title: Much better than I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: A little dubious at first due to some of the unjustified reviews that others have posted but, I have to say we had a great time there.
reviews.title: Very good as usual

likes.disliked: — The restaurant in the main building.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, Wile (the porter) was great!! Really nice guy that helped us with our bags, took us to our room, told us where was good to eat and warned us about some of the restaurants trying to overcharge. Invited us to a pool party on his day off which unfortunately we couldn't make but, it was the thought that counts!
reviews.title: Strand Underwhelming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was some confusion when we got there as we requested a balcony with the one bedroom oceanview suite; we had the oceanview but, no balcony. Now as both of us smoke neither of us wanted to go out/downstairs just to have a cigarette but, Jose was more than accomodating. Although the next room we were given wasn't directly facing the beach we could still see the ocean and beach from our balcony and it was a much more spacious room.
reviews.title: A little slice of Heaven on Ocean Drive !!!!!!!

likes.liked: — Everything was so wonderful I cannot choose just one thing !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now, it's true that you can here the music from the bars and restaurants until the early hours but, if your the kind of person that's not going to be able to handle that then don't stay on Ocean Drive!! Simple as...... You're in a tourist area, opposite the beach, where people eat, drink and party til the early morning so if this is not for you, go stay in a big resort on the top floor where you can be in your element with your slippers and blanket watching tv!!!!
reviews.title: had potential but missed the wow factor
